# Videos from session #05

![][13]![][14]

 _Videos: Testing: Mocha, data storage, state machines, events,
(mocking)_

We held our 5th session - on testing [smart contract](https://www.letsplayfx.com/blog/smart-contract-on-blockchain/)s - yesterday, on
Tuesday evening at BitTemple. We built upon the example contract from
Session #04, by writing some tests to ensure that it behaves as it
should. But **before** delving right into testing [smart contract](https://www.letsplayfx.com/blog/smart-contract-on-blockchain/)s with
truffle, we spent a bit of time exploring what software testing is, and
writing good old Javascript tests, using Mocha.

More on that ~~later, when we get the round up summary post out!~~ here,
in our [round up post for this session][15], which does a summary/ recap
of what went on.

## The videos

## Thanks

A big thanks to [Wing][22] for helping with the recordings, to Solomon
from [BitTemple][23] for coordinating and setting up the venue.

Also thanks to EngineersSG, especially [Michael Cheng][24], for their
excellent [DIY tech meetup recording guide][25] without which we would
probably have no recordings!

## News

As mentioned in our video post for session #04, all of our videos are
now available on Engineers.SG!

Check us out: [DApps Dev Club on Engineers.SG][26]

## Reflections

Cobbling together the images and creating the banner image for these
posts has thus far been a manual process, and thus **extremely** time
consuming.

I have been putting off writing a script to automate this, using this as
an excuse:

[![XKDC: Automation][27]][28]

a€¦ but _finally_ recognised procrastination for what it was, and bit
the bullet, and went ahead and wrote one - will be adding that to [our
github organisation][8] once it has been cleaned up (it is simply too
scrappy at the moment ðŸ˜Š).

## Next session

RSVPs are now open for our _next_ session - please let us know if you're
attending, as it helps us plan for seating, ordering F&B, etc:

[**RSVP** on eventbrite][29]

See you all again soon! ðŸ¤˜
